question: What is the theme of the 2017 World Blood Donor Day (WBDD)?
option1: Thank you for saving my life
option3: Every blood donor is a hero
option4: Give Blood. Give Now. Give Often
answer: Give Blood. Give Now. Give Often
explanation: The World Blood Donor Day (WBDD) is observed every year on June 14 to raise awareness of the need for safe blood and blood products, and to thank blood donors for their voluntary, life-saving gifts of blood. Every pint of blood donated can save more than 3 lives. Thus, if you began donating blood at age 18 and donated every 90 days until you reached 60, you would have donated 30 gallons of blood, potentially helping save more than 500 lives. The 2017 theme “Give Blood. Give Now. Give Often” focus on blood donation in emergency situations.
